text: Parvateesam is an Indian actor who primarily appears in Telugu cinema. He gained recognition for his role in the 2015 film Kerintha and has since acted in multiple films across various genres. == Career == === 2015 === Parvateesam made his acting debut in the 2015 Telugu film Kerintha, directed by Sai Kiran Adivi, where he played the role of a college student. The film was based on friendship and relationships among young adults. === 2016 === In Rojulu Marayi, he played a supporting character in a romantic thriller. He also appeared in Nanna Nenu Na Boyfriends, a drama about a young woman and her relationships, in which he had a supporting role. === 2018 === He acted in Bhale Manchi Chowka Beram, a film combining crime and comedy. His role was part of a series of events that unfolded in the storyline. === 2019 === In Operation Gold Fish, an action thriller, he did a supporting character. The film followed a patriotic theme, and his role was part of the larger narrative. === 2021 === He appeared in Savithri W/O Sathyamurthy, a comedy- drama. His character was included in the film’s humor-driven sequences. === 2022 === He had roles in Induvadana, which featured historical and romantic elements, and Jagannatakam, a drama with a suspense-driven narrative. === 2023 === Parvateesam was part of Gammathu, an OTT release. The film contained elements of drama and humor. === 2024 === He acted in Mercy Killing, a film based on a social issue, and Market Mahalakshmi, a drama-comedy. His roles were part of ensemble casts. === 2025 === In Thandel, He did a key role as part of the film’s main narrative. == Filmography == Year Title 2015 Kerintha 2016 Rojulu Marayi Nanna Nenu Naa Boyfriends 2018 Bhale Manchi Chowka Beram 2019 Operation Gold Fish 2021 Savitri W/o Satyamurthy 2022 Induvadana Jagannatakam 2023 Gammathu 2024 Mercy Killing Market Mahalakshmi 2025 Thandel == References == == Categories == Category:Living people Category:Indian movie actors Category:Telugu actors Category:21st-century Indian actors
title: Parvateesam
